intro: Gonzalagunia, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or red when mature. Gonzalagunia thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
